A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I can't say this is my favorite of the new Star Wars Trilogy\, it had moments I was very much not a fan of. That being said\, over all\, I really enjoyed the movie. I love that they didn't bow to fan theories and I absolutely adored Laura Dern as Vice Admiral Holdo. I know a lot of people seem to hate the character\, and on my first viewing\, I wasn't sure about her\, but after seeing the movie again\, I loved her. She didn't cow-tow to the main characters\, she had a plan and pulled it off in a very similar manner to how Leia would have. I admit\, I teared up a few times when Carrie was on the screen\, some of her lines took on a lot more gravity now than they did when the movie was filmed. And I thought\, Mark Hamill\, once again\, proved his chops as an actor. I don't agree with some of the things they did with the character\, but he made you believe they were choices Luke could have made. As I said\, over all\, a really fun movie!
